required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Multi-Centre Clinical Evaluation Of Two Daily Disposable Contact Lenses
clinical_study.official_title: Multi-Centre Clinical Evaluation Of Two Daily Disposable Contact Lenses

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare the subjective performance for handling of two daily disposable contact lenses, stenfilcon A and etafilcon A.

primary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks and four weeks from baseline visit
primary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective rating for lens handling of Pair #1 surveyed at 2 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit and Pair #2 surveyed at 4 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit. Each pair worn for two weeks daily disposable wear basis (at least 40 hours per week). Lenses worn minimum 2 hours prior to visit. Rated by questionnaires (0-10, 10= very easy).

primary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks and four weeks from baseline visit
primary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective rating for overall satisfaction of lens handling of Pair #1 surveyed at 2 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit and Pair #2 surveyed at 4 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit. Each pair worn for two weeks daily disposable wear basis (at least 40 hours per week). Lenses worn minimum 2 hours prior to visit. Rated by questionnaires (5 point Likert scale - Completely Dissatisfied, Somewhat Dissatisfied, Neither, Somewhat Satisfied, Completely Satisfied).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks and four weeks from baseline visit
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective rating for overall lens comfort of Pair #1 surveyed at 2 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit and Pair #2 surveyed at 4 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit. Lenses worn minimum 2 hours prior to visit. Rated by questionnaires (0-10, 10=can't feel).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks and four weeks from baseline visit
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective rating for overall lens dryness of Pair #1 surveyed at 2 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit and Pair #2 surveyed at 4 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit. Each pair worn for two weeks daily disposable wear basis (at least 40 hours per week). Lenses worn minimum 2 hours prior to visit. Rated by questionnaires (0-10, 10=no dryness).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks and four weeks from baseline visit
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective rating for overall satisfaction of lens dryness of Pair #1 surveyed at 2 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit and Pair #2 surveyed at 4 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit. Each pair worn for two weeks daily disposable wear basis (at least 40 hours per week). Lenses worn minimum 2 hours prior to visit. Rated by questionnaires (5 point Likert scale - Completely Dissatisfied, Somewhat Dissatisfied, Neither, Somewhat Satisfied, Completely Satisfied).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: two weeks and four weeks from baseline visit
secondary_outcome.description: Participant's subjective rating for overall satisfaction of lens comfort of Pair #1 surveyed at 2 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit and Pair #2 surveyed at 4 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit. Each pair worn for two weeks daily disposable wear basis (at least 40 hours per week). Lenses worn minimum 2 hours prior to visit. Rated by questionnaires (5 point Likert scale - Completely Dissatisfied, Somewhat Dissatisfied, Neither, Somewhat Satisfied, Completely Satisfied).

arm_group.description: Participants wear a first pair of lenses for two weeks and then crossover and wear an alternate second pair of lenses for two weeks.
Participants wear a first pair of lenses for two weeks and then crossover and wear an alternate second pair of lenses for two weeks.

intervention.description: Participants wear a first pair of lenses for two weeks and then crossover and wear an alternate second pair of lenses for two weeks.
Participants wear a first pair of lenses for two weeks and then crossover and wear an alternate second pair of lenses for two weeks.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:-
- Be between 16 and 45 years of age (inclusive)
- Adapted soft contact lens (CL) wearers (i.e. > 1 month)
- Spherical distance CL prescription between -1.00 and -6.00D (inclusive)
- Spectacle cylinder ≤0.75D in the least astigmatic eye, ≤1.00D in the other.
- Correctable to 6/9 (20/30) in both eyes
- Have the use of a mobile phone to send and receive text messages throughout the day for the duration of the study.
- Have read, understood and signed the informed consent
- Willing to comply with the wear schedule (at least 40 hours per week)
- Willing to comply with the study visit schedule
Exclusion Criteria:-
- Any active corneal infection, injury or inflammation
- Systemic or ocular allergies, which might interfere with CL wear
- Systemic disease, which might interfere with CL wear
- Ocular disease, which might interfere with CL wear
- Strabismus, amblyopia
- Subjects who have undergone corneal refractive surgery and any anterior segment surgery
- Subjects with keratoconus or other severe corneal irregularity contraindicating lens wear
- Pregnant or lactating
- Use of systemic/topical medication contraindicating CL wear
- Use of gas permeable contact lenses within the last month
- Employees of the investigational site or immediate family members of Investigators
- Participation in any concurrent clinical trial or in the last 30 days

participant_flow.recruitment_details: Number subjects enrolled per site ranged six to 25. Two sites were asked to enroll more than 20 subjects to fulfill required number of subjects. Approval from Ethics Committee sought before sites were invited to recruit additional subjects. Of the 100 enrolled, 13 were existing etafilcon A wearers, falling short of the 25% target.
participant_flow.pre_assignment_details: All participants randomized to receive all interventions and combined into one Arm/Group, “Overall All Study Population” for the participant flow.

group.title: Stenfilcon A Then Etafilcon A
group.description: All subjects assigned as overall study population wore both sets of lenses. Overall study population was randomized to wear either stenfilcon A followed by etafilcon A or etafilcon A followed by stenfilcon A.

group.title: Etafilcon A Then Stenfilcon A
group.description: All subjects assigned as overall study population wore both sets of lenses. Study population was randomized to wear either stenfilcon A followed by etafilcon A or etafilcon A followed by stenfilcon A.

baseline.population: All subjects assigned as overall study population wore both sets of lenses. Study population was randomized to wear either stenfilcon A followed by etafilcon A or etafilcon A followed by stenfilcon A.

group.title: Stenfilcon A Then Etafilcon A
group.description: All subjects assigned as overall study population wore both sets of lenses. Overall study population was randomized to wear either stenfilcon A followed by etafilcon A or etafilcon A followed by stenfilcon A.

group.title: Etafilcon A Then Stenfilcon A
group.description: All subjects assigned as overall study population wore both sets of lenses. Overall study population was randomized to wear either stenfilcon A followed by etafilcon A or etafilcon A followed by stenfilcon A.

outcome.title: Handling
outcome.description: Participant’s subjective rating for lens handling of Pair #1 surveyed at 2 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit and Pair #2 surveyed at 4 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit. Each pair worn for two weeks daily disposable wear basis (at least 40 hours per week). Lenses worn minimum 2 hours prior to visit. Rated by questionnaires (0-10, 10= very easy).
outcome.time_frame: two weeks and four weeks from baseline visit

group.title: Stenfilcon A
group.description: Participants randomized to wear a first pair of lenses for two weeks and then crossover and wear an alternate second pair of lenses for two weeks. (Stenfilcon A then etafilcon A and/or etafilcon A then stenfilcon A.)

group.title: Etafilcon A
group.description: Participants randomized to wear a first pair of lenses for two weeks and then crossover and wear an alternate second pair of lenses for two weeks. (Stenfilcon A then etafilcon A and/or etafilcon A then stenfilcon A.)

measure.title: Handling
measure.description: Participant’s subjective rating for lens handling of Pair #1 surveyed at 2 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit and Pair #2 surveyed at 4 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit. Each pair worn for two weeks daily disposable wear basis (at least 40 hours per week). Lenses worn minimum 2 hours prior to visit. Rated by questionnaires (0-10, 10= very easy).

outcome.title: Comfort
outcome.description: Participant’s subjective rating for overall lens comfort of Pair #1 surveyed at 2 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit and Pair #2 surveyed at 4 weeks (+3) days after baseline visit. Lenses worn minimum 2 hours prior to visit. Rated by questionnaires (0-10, 10=can't feel).
outcome.time_frame: two weeks and four weeks from baseline visit

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The investigators will not be permitted to publish or present at scientific meetings results obtained from the clinical study without prior written consent from the sponsor.
